meanings.definition: A charge or fee for a service, especially for use of a road or bridge.
meanings.sent1: The toll to cross the bridge was only one dollar.
meanings.sent2: Drivers had to pay the toll before entering the highway.
meanings.sent3: The toll for using the magical teleportation service was a bag of gold coins.
meanings.sent4: The toll of time slowly eroded the ancient stone bridge.
meanings.sent5: The toll for admission to the concert was a smile and a song.

meanings.definition: The sound of a bell ringing.
meanings.sent1: The toll of the church bell echoed through the village.
meanings.sent2: The toll of the bell signaled the start of the ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The toll of the bell was so loud it startled the birds in the trees.
meanings.sent4: The toll of the bell carried a message of peace across the valley.
meanings.sent5: The toll of the bell was a comforting sound on a quiet evening.

meanings.sent1: The harsh words began to toll on her self-esteem.
meanings.sent2: The constant stress started to toll on his health.
meanings.sent3: The never-ending meetings began to toll on everyone's patience.
meanings.sent4: The toll of the long winter affected the crops in the fields.
meanings.sent5: The toll of the exhausting journey left them weary but wiser.
